resources.string: The number of shots that you successfully made divided by the number of shots that you attempted to make
The average number of balls pocketed per turn at the table (only turns that you attempted to make a ball count towards this average)
Shots that you attempted that ended up being a foul
The percentage of shots that you successfully executed divided by the number of shots you attempted
The number of shots that you successfully executed divided by the number of shots that you attempted
The number of offensive shots taken divided by the total number of shots taken (shots and safeties), break shots are not included in this
The number of games that you won divided by the number of shots that you attempted
The number of safeties that you successfully made divided by the number of safeties that you attempted
Safeties that you attempted that ended up being a foul
The number of times that you came to the table after your opponent played a safety on you that you successfully made a ball
The number of times that you came to the table after your opponent played a safety on you that you successfully played safe back
The number of times that your opponent forced you into making an error
The number of times that you were able to pocket a ball immediately following the break
The number of breaks that you successfully made a ball divided by the number of breaks attempted
The average number of balls pocketed per break
The number of breaks that you fouled on
The number of breaks that you successfully made the 8/9 ball on and won the game
The number of times that you broke and ran
The number of times that you ran the maximum number of balls possible to win the game
The number of times that you made 5 or fewer balls to win the game
The number of times that you won the game because of making the 8/9/10 ball early, three fouling your opponent, or winning on the break
Players cannot have the same name
Would you like to delete this match?
View advanced stats for this match
The APA rank of the player
The number of balls that were not pocketed throughout the match
The number of innings in the match; please look up how innings are scored in the official APA rules
The number of points that each player has earned
The minimum number of match points earned by each player; when the match has finished it will display the actual points earned
Full hooks are when the incoming player cannot see any edge of their object ball(s)
Partial hooks are when the incoming player can only see a part of their object ball(s) and it is not able to be cut into a pocket
Long Ts are when the incoming player\'s object ball is on one of the short rails and the cue ball is half a table or more away and the angle to cut the ball in is greater than 70 degrees
Short Ts are the same as long Ts except the balls are on the long rails
No direct shot is when the player has clear view of the ball but there isn\'t a pocket available to cut it into
What type of safety did you play?
A shot in which the player attempted and got a result that they would define as a safety
The player attempted and failed to get a shot that they would define as a safety
The player missed/fouled on their break attempt
The player attempted to pocket a ball and missed
The player satisfied the conditions of the game and won
The player elects to continue shooting the game how it currently lies, after entering this turn they can then input their new turn
Restarts the game and has $player break
The break didn\'t satisfy the rules of the game you are currently playing and is considered illegal
A shot that hits one or more rails on it\'s way to the pocket; does not include the rail that is directly connected to the pocket or the ball hitting the sides of the pocket
Using the cue ball or an object ball to hit one or more balls, causing it (them) to go in
Using an object to hit one or more object balls in a row to cause a ball to go in
A shot in which you are contacting the object ball and trying to directly put it into a pocket
Jumping the cue ball or object ball off the table to avoid an impeding ball
Using the cue ball to hit one or more rails to make contact with a ball
A shot in which the cue ball and object ball are lined up and in line with the intended pocket
Imparting downward spin on the cue ball to get it to swerve and avoid impeding balls
How much angle was your cut shot?
The amount of angle that you needed to cut the object ball to make it into it\'s intended pocket
The cue ball and object ball are in line or close to in line with a straight on hit to bank the ball
You have to cross over the object ball to get the correct hit to bank the ball
You are banking across the length of the table (long side)
You are banking across the width of the table (short side)
Clicking on a ball will toggle it\'s status
This ball is currently on the table; tapping it will set it to made
This ball has been selected, which means that it has been legally pocketed
Tapping a ball twice will set it\'s status to \'dead,\' meaning that it does not count as a made ball for the current player
This ball is not on the table and is not selectable
A back cut is when you\'re looking at the cue ball and cannot see the pocket
A wing cut is a cut shot that you can see the pocket while you are shooting
A down the rail shot is when the cue ball is on or very close to the rail and going into one of the corner pockets
The foul was on the break and you pocketed the 8 ball (APA rules), your opponent put you on two fouls and you fouled again, etc.
The end result of your shot was that your opponent got ball in hand
On a masse shot if the ball curves later than you inteded
On a masse shot if the ball curves earlier than you inteded
The cue ball hit to the left of where you were aiming
The cue ball hit to the right of where you were aiming
The cue ball hit the object ball too thick
The cue ball hit the object ball too thin
The object ball banked shorter than you intended
The object ball banked longer than you intended
The cue ball kicked longer than you intended
The cue ball kicked shorter than you intended
%1$s has the option to skip their turn
No push shot or option to skip turn is allowed
